abstract: Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rises 4.5 percent in December, up from 4.3 percent in November; Conference Board reports that its consumer confidence index fell to 96.4 in February, from revised 103.8 in January; other reports indicate slight slowdown of United States economic growth and brisk expansion in the service sector.
lead_paragraph: A report released on Tuesday showed a modest rise in December home prices, most likely because fewer homes were for sale. Other data found a dip in consumer confidence.

headline.main: Home Prices Inch Upward, but Consumer Confidence Weakens
headline.print_headline: Home Prices Inch Upward, but Consumer Confidence Weakens

snippet: A report released on Tuesday showed a modest rise in December home prices, most likely because fewer homes were for sale. Other data found a dip in consumer confidence.

keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
